In this session we study **collective motion**: how local alignment rules create global order. The main example is the Vicsek model, with optional predator interaction.

## What do we need?

### `matplotlib.pyplot`

Initialize the figure and axes and draw static elements.

### `matplotlib.animation`

Update plot elements in real time for animations.

### `matplotlib.Slider`

Add sliders so users can interact with parameters.

### `matplotlib.backend_bases`

Track mouse position and clicks for interactive behavior.

## References

- [@vicsek1995novel]
- Check [this cool simulation](https://www.complexity-explorables.org/explorables/flockn-roll/). This explorable illustrates of an intuitive dynamic model for collective motion (swarming) in animal groups. The model can be used to describe collective behavior observed in schooling fish or flocking birds, for example. The details of the model are described in [@couzin2002collective].
